title: Make rumqttc::client::Iter public
body: So this is perhaps a little esoteric, but in order to implement some foreign traits (https://docs.rs/embedded-svc/0.21.2/embedded_svc/mqtt/client/trait.Connection.html), I need to be able to wrap the `Iter` returned by `rumqttc::Connection.iter()`.  Maybe there are some arcane tricks to do this using a trait object over `Iterator`, but if there are, I haven't been able to get it to work right, and, regardless, it's incredibly awkward.  Much more straightforward would be to be able to just embed the actual type of `Iter` into my struct, but I can't because it's declared only in a private module.

title: Improve Error texts
body:
Initially I wanted to just add details for the `mqttbytes::Error` in the `StateError`. I continued with other `thiserror::Error` implementations to improve error details.

Something that is not the same everywhere is the formatting style: `text: {0}`, `text {0}` or `text = {0}` are used currently. I could also improve that with this PR but I am not sure with format is preferred. Maybe `text: {0}`?

title: rumqttc: convert all direct index access to `get_mut`
body: Fixes #201

title: Limit GitHub actions to running only on PRs affecting code/dependencies
body: Only changes in files with paths `**.rs` and `*Cargo.*`

title: Add stale-issue management bot configuration
body:
Marks as stale if issues are not active for over 20 days

uses [probot/stale](https://github.com/probot/stale)

title: Reorganize `ConnectionError`
body:
Create new variants for `ConnectionError` instead of repackaging as `io::Error`

Solves #252

title: Make rustls optional
body:
Closes #305

Enables the compilation of `rumqttc` without rustls/TLS support by using `--no-default-features` flag during compilation. `rustls` support is enabled by default, otherwise can be enabled with `use_rustls` feature flag.

- Automate releasing rumqttc and rumqttd to crates.io

Upgrades `rumqttd` to v0.10, `rumqttc` to v0.11 and documents relevant changes.

title: Move code into broker and client crate
body:
- Move `mqttbytes` code into client and broker crates.
- Move `rumqttlog` into broker.
- Remove code associated with `rumqttmesh`.
- Clean up.

title: Update how rumqtt is documented
body: Update and improve documentation within READMEs and rest of the repo

title: benchmarks: add a version agnostic simple router
rumqttc v5
body:
Add supports for MQTTv5 to rumqttc, along with following changes (only in v5, v4 not changed):
- Use `Arc<Mutex<VecDeque<Request>>>` instead of async-channel to send requests from client to eventloop
- pkids are returned when calling subscribe from client.
- code for parsing v5 packets copied from mqttbytes, remove its use
- use flume instead of async_channel and pollster
- different (and hopefully more intuitive) APIs, with option to run eventloop in background by default
- No longer supporting informing about outgoing events via eventloop

title: Fix documentation for PUB* packets
body: Closes #347

body: Close #343 with a basic example.

title: Remove `must_use` attribute over `poll()`
body: Currently the `must_use` attribute is being applied to the `Future` instead of `Eventloop::poll()` itself.

title: Support for manual acks
body:
This PR introduces support for manual acknowledgements.
With `MqttOptions.manual_acks = true` every message must be manually acked with `client.ack()` method.
By using manual acknowledgements users are able to guarantee that they will not loose any messages.
